intro: Eugenia mufindiensis, commonly known as the Mufindi euonymus, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of eastern Africa, particularly Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically oval and glossy. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink, followed by small, edible berries. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native habitat.
